title: Just a Minor Editing Error in the Bilgewater Event Page!
body: I'm not sure if I'm the first to report it, but I figured I should let you guys know! I don't think TF is a "card sharp" (though I could be wrong), but he's definitely a "card shark". I LOVE THIS EVENT SO FAR!  [Here's a picture of the error.](http://i.imgur.com/Qz6YNUX.png)

replies.body:
I can totally see why you would call him a card shark, but a [card _sharp_ is a valid term too](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Card_sharp#Etymology_and_usage) - it means one who cheats or swindles with cards!  The terms have a very similar history, and some say that 'sharp' is more likely associated negatively, than the slightly more positively viewed 'shark'.  

Warning: Etymology Online links follow (as dangerous as a TVtropes link in my opinion!)

Sharp; http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=sharp&allowed_in_frame=0
vs.
Shark; http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=shark&allowed_in_frame=0

(I wasn't involved in writing these, but I do love words :))
Every time I hear someone say "_Chomping_ at the bit"... I know it's acceptable but it still irks me.

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=fJKYj503,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-07-26T02:22:48.951+0000)
>
> Every time I hear someone say "_Chomping_ at the bit"... I know it's acceptable but it still irks me.

it's really CHAMPing at the bit, isn't it.

Jaredan is from England.

Chances are, he chose his preferred "card sharp" to the Americanized "card shark."

I use card shark actually. I never use card sharp in my own speech, but it's the original usage. Card shark came later, and card sharp (or cardsharp) has more of a history of referring to someone cheating to win. One of our editors pointed it out and we went with it.

Also, I've learned to use American English in my editing and writing since coming to the States several years ago.

Still, I can't bring myself to call football "soccer," no matter the etymology. It just feels like I'm betraying my heritage. Oh, and I can't say "aloominum." It's just wrong. WRONG!

/twitch.
Remember to keep colour, color is dumb, and in Canada which is still part of NA that is the official spelling, turn them to our side, if at all possible.
But wouldn't Twisted Fate prefer the Americanized term, considering his character seems to borrow heavily from - well - america? :P
